title: To Celebrate His 67th Birthday, Vladimir Putin Takes A Hike In The Siberian Mountains
text:
To Celebrate His 67th Birthday, Vladimir Putin Takes A Hike In The Siberian Mountains

To Celebrate His 67th Birthday, Vladimir Putin Takes A Hike In The Siberian Mountains

To mark his 67th year, Russian President Vladimir Putin chose the calm of nature and we must say it's a much better option than waking up hungover the next day after partying hard.

Russian President Vladimir Putin and some of his top officials took a break from state affairs ahead of his birthday and accompanied him for a long hike in the Siberian mountains.

Russian television also broadcast some of Putin’s trip, showing the adventure-loving leader hiking to a cliff and then pausing to take in the view of the Yenisei River.

He chose the Siberian taiga forest to go on a hike ahead of his October 7 birthday.

Putin has visited the area in the Tuva region near the Mongolian border several times over the past few years. In 2009, he was photographed riding shirtless on a horse. Two years ago, he and Shoigu fished bare-chested in the pristine lakes.

In 2017, Putin said that he had celebrated his birthday with Chinese President Xi Jinping, “drinking vodka and eating sausages”.
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is renowned for posing for high-octane photo opportunities like tiger-tracking or deepwater diving. But in images released to celebrate his birthday on Monday, the long-term leader was seen enjoying some of Russia's more peaceful wildlife.
